definitions: A feature in data processing systems that ensures data is not lost even if there are system failures. It provides a persistent and fault-tolerant mechanism for storing and delivering data.
A sequence of data elements that are designed to persist over time and remain available despite interruptions or failures in the processing system.
examples: Implementing durable streams is crucial for financial transaction systems.
The new architecture leverages durable streams for event logging.
Data integrity is maintained through the use of durable streams.
